Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "GitHubVulnerabilties2Db build break due to DI change" (#8515) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Including the feature flag service in the constructor of the package service has broken dependency injection in GitHubVulnerabilities2Db.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix break in githubvulnerabilities2db dependency injection" (#8516) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Address: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8515

Dependency injection was broken by the inclusion of the feature flag service in the package service constructor. Added a fake type for this and moved it and an additional fake into a fakes directory.

[this surfaced in BCDR analysis]

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Improve error message when uploading package with poorly formed TFMs" (#8519) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We currently see this when a poorly formed TFM is included in a package:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/114493318-b0617280-9c5d-11eb-807e-d12907c984b9.png)

Let's give it more descriptive text. The code that validates TFMs is here: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/c71e12429b108c4d87e2da41790b164149a43389/src/NuGetGallery.Services/PackageManagement/PackageService.cs#L67-L96

We can respond to specific exceptions from `ToShortNameOrNull` etc and throw appropriately.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improved the #r directive instructions" (#8481) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This issue is to track pull request: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8405 created by @filipw :
 
This is a follow up to #8375

Since #r is not exclusive to F#, it is a bit inaccurate to use the current header for the instructions - it would make sense to use a more generic name for it.
Therefore I propose to rename F# Interactive to .NET Interactive as it then correctly captures both C# and F#.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Manage Organisation_Reflow: On zooming the screen content to 400% both the scrollbar appear to view the screen." (#8489) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Link: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1294821

## Environment Details:
Application Name: NuGet Service
#URL: https://www.nuget.org
Operating System: Windows 10
Browser Version: Chrome Version 85.0.4183.121 (Official Build) (64-bit),
Chromium Edge Version 87.0.637.0 (Official build) dev (64-bit)

## Repro Steps:‚Äã
 Hit the URL " https://www.nuget.org" and login with appropriate credentials.
Tab Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
 Tab Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
Select ‚ÄúManage Organizations‚Äù from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
Tab navigate to browser setting and zoom the screen content at400% and observe horizontal/vertical scroll bar present to view the content.
## Actual:‚Äã
When the users zoom the screen content to 400% the data on the screen can be viewed with both the scrollbar i.e. Vertical and Horizontal which is incorrect as just one of the scrollbar show be available.
## Expected:‚Äã
The data on the screen should be viewed with only one of the scrollbar when zoomed to 400%.
## ‚ÄãUser Impact:‚Äã
When users zoom the screen content to 400% and if they have to view the screen content with both the scrollbar then they will find difficulty in viewing and reading the content present on the screen.

### Notes
There was a similar bug filed a while back that was fixed by moving the overflow on the to table, since scrollbar on page is the issue, not scrollbar on particular content.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Organization name and email fields are mandatory but not represented as mandatory fields." (#8492) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Link: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1296190

‚Äã## Environment Details:
Application Name: NuGet Service
#URL: https://www.nuget.org
Operating System: Windows 10
Browser Version: Chrome Version 85.0.4183.121 (Official Build) (64-bit),
Chromium Edge Version 87.0.637.0 (Official build) dev (64-bit)

## Repro Steps:‚Äã
 Hit the URL " https://www.nuget.org" and login with appropriate credentials.
Tab Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
 Tab Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
Select ‚ÄúManage Organizations‚Äù from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
Tab navigate to Add new link and hit enter.
Tab navigate to Organization name and email fields and observe these fields are mandatory but not provided as required field.
## Actual:‚Äã
Tab navigate to Organization name and email fields are mandatory but not represented as mandatory fields.
## Expected:‚Äã
Tab navigate to Organization name and email fields should be represented as mandatory fields with the required keyword.
‚Äã## User Impact:‚Äã
Keyboard only user will not not understand that field is mandatory if field is not marked with required keyword.

### Notes
We should update these fields to follow whatever pattern we use for other required field (asterisk, etc)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add instructions to install .NET Tools as local" (#8373) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet Gallery UI for .NET Tools shows instructions on how to install them as global tools, but doesn't have instructions for installing as a local tool.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177608/104142779-5d90ca00-5393-11eb-8113-10cf8bb1fa47.png)

---

### Proposed UI

I suggest adding a new tab for instructions on how to install it as a local tool, including creating the tool manifest, as that's currently required.

![2021-01-10_22-26-15 (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177608/104142789-67b2c880-5393-11eb-9c55-bfd58d8526bd.gif)

- Rename the existing ".NET CLI" tab to ".NET CLI (Global)"
- Update the info text at the bottom to `This package contains a .NET Tool you can call from the shell/command line.`
- Add new tab ".NET CLI (Local)" with the following instructions:
```powershell
> dotnet new tool-manifest
> dotnet tool install --local <ToolName> --version <ToolVersion>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The correct ID casing should be displayed for the selected version" (#3349) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Problem 

It seems like the casing of a package ID in the package web page is determined by the first version's ID casing. For example, consider the "sqlite" package ID.

ID | Version
---|---------
sqlite | 3.8.4.2
SQLite |3.9.1-test
SQLite | 3.12.2-alpha
SQLite | 3.12.2
SQLite | 3.12.3
SQLite | 3.13.0

If you go to a specific version on NuGet.org (e.g. https://www.nuget.org/packages/sqlite/3.13.0) the ID casing in the page's heading and example install command is not `SQLite`. It is `sqlite`. 

The package author's intended case is apparent in the .nuspec contained in the .nupkg.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/94054/20278933/6ef51a48-aa5b-11e6-8cb8-5ff85bb8d5e2.png)

Package IDs are case insensitive, but the package author's intended case is still important.

Here is a list of popular packages affected by this bug:

LatestId | TotalDownloads
-- | --
Swashbuckle.AspNetCore.SwaggerUI | 96334268
Npgsql | 54283023
Hangfire.Core | 30446646
SendGrid | 25779632
Microsoft.Data.Sqlite | 20418313
SharpCompress | 19417928
NCrontab.Signed | 17268104
Hangfire.SqlServer | 17034720
StructureMap | 14500086
Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch | 14448135
morelinq | 14230167
iTextSharp | 13785720
NCrontab | 13670550
Hangfire | 12792338
Refit | 12481531
Topshelf | 11030897
MongoDB.LibMongocrypt | 10757761
NServiceBus | 9493951
NuGet.Core | 7609245
PDFsharp | 7562855

# Solution

1. Add a nullable `Id` column to the `Packages` table.
1. On package upload, store the package Id in the new column
1. Anywhere the package ID is displayed, display the `Package.Id` value if it is non-null, otherwise display the `PackageRegistration.Id` value.
1. Update reflow to set the `Package.Id` value if it is null.
1. Update Db2AzureSearch to use the `Package.Id` value if it is non-null, otherwise use the `PackageRegistration.Id` value. See:  https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3349#issuecomment-730649782

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Update Semver2 package details message (add Rider)" (#4089) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "MsBuild restore task doesn't use packages.config path from RestorePackagesConfigPath" (#10744) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I use the latest MSBuild version to restore NuGet packages from the packages.config file. There are a lot of properties Restore* that I can manage to change needed fields. One of this property is RestorePackagesConfigPath but as it turned out this property doesn't matter at all, since the path to this file is hardcoded as project folder path + "packages.config" constant (see line 477 NuGet.Client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/BuildTasksUtility.cs)

–°an we add the use of this property or this is intentional and there is a kinda special reason not to do that?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet restore failing on .NET 5 for Archlinux" (#10695) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
disclaimer: seems related to *NuGet restore failing on .NET 5 for Debian-based OSes (CA trust changed)* aka #10491 

## Details about Problem
Using the archlinux package: `community/dotnet-sdk 5.0.4.sdk104-1` (47.3 MiB 165.6 MiB)

## Repro steps and/or sample project
Here a simple exe to create snk key (since this tools is still not available on MacOS and Linux dotnet cli)
see: https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/7183

```sh
$ cd ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey
$ cat CreateSigningKey.csproj
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>Exe</OutputType>
    <TargetFramework>netcoreapp2.1</TargetFramework>
    <!-- see https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/12237 -->
    <RollForward>LatestMajor</RollForward>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```
src: https://github.com/google/or-tools/blob/stable/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj

### Verbose Logs
When trying to restore
```sh
$ dotnet restore
  Determining projects to restore...
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref 3.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Ref 3.1.10' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3037: Package 'Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref 3.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3037: Package 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Ref 3.1.10' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref 3.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The repository countersignature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
/home/mizux/work/master/ortools/dotnet/CreateSigningKey/CreateSigningKey.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Ref 3.1.10' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The repository countersignature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
```

FYI 
```sh
$ dotnet --info
.NET SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   5.0.104
 Commit:    ca6b6acadb

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     arch
 OS Version:  
 OS Platform: Linux
 RID:         arch-x64
 Base Path:   /usr/share/dotnet/sdk/5.0.104/

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 5.0.4
  Commit:  269e323b5f

.NET SDKs installed:
  5.0.104 [/usr/share/dotnet/sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 5.0.4 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App]

To install additional .NET runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download
```

Maybe should be added to https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/49 in "Other distros" ?
EDIT: This issue is added to https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/56

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Upload nuget package to nuget.org tip NU3018" (#10693) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe):
NuGet.exe
Product version: 
5.9.0.7134

## Repro steps and/or sample project
### Command line :
````
PS E:\xxx\.Repositories\NuGet> .\nuget.exe verify -Signatures .\Signs\A123.1.0.0.nupkg

Verifying A123.1.0.0
E:\xxx\.Repositories\NuGet\.\Signs\A123.1.0.0.nupkg

Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
Timestamp: 2021/3/25 17:59:26

Verifying author primary signature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=DigiCert Timestamp 2021, O="DigiCert, Inc.", C=US
  SHA1 hash: E1D782A8E191BEEF6BCA1691B5AAB494A6249BF3
  SHA256 hash: B3109006BC0AD98307915729E04403415C83E3292B614F26964C8D3571ECF5A9
  Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Timestamping CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
  Valid from: 2021/1/1 8:00:00 to 2031/1/6 8:00:00

Signature type: Author
Verifying the author primary signature with certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=NuGet Package Developer Cert, OU=xxx
  SHA1 hash: E955B4389511Fxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx001BBD5B1236A7F
  SHA256 hash: 1748F56443DEACF7xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx497D685FC18A07B83D99776A389
  Issued by: CN=NuGet Package Developer Cert, OU=xxx
  Valid from: 2021/3/25 15:36:24 to 2022/3/25 15:56:24

Successfully verified package 'RMBer.1.0.0'.
````
The signature and verification are successful, but the upload message is **NU3018**.

### Verbose Logs
````
Package publishing failed. This package could not be published due to the following reason(s):
NU3018: The author primary signature found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider.
````

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Improve error messaging for projects with multiple AssemblyNames" (#10766) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

This is directly this issue: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5226

Just opening this issue for the simple reason that this got me for a few days as I was unable to find exactly what was causing the issues.

If there is a way to have an actual error message that could effectively mean "Unable to find unique ID for project when restoring. Either use the same AssemblyName for all TFMs or add a PackageId."

Or something like that. This looks like some internal error that gets out and there is no ay to figure it out. I had to add back my project line by line and it was time consuming as I have quite a few projects and quite a few TFMs in there.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): all

Product version: all

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 

## Repro steps and/or sample project

<!-- Please add as much details as possible to help us to reproduce your problem. -->

### Verbose Logs

<!-- Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...) -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "How to include files that are not part of the "contentFiles" folder?" (#10765) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues) -->

I'm not sure if I understand this part https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/nuspec#including-content-files correctly but nuget assumes I have folder named "contentFiles" within my project?

I only have "icon" folder directly in folder of my project.

So, if paths in `include` attribute suppose to be relative to that folder I should be able to write following?

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<package>
  <metadata>
    <contentFiles>
      <files include="..\icons\**" buildAction="None" copyToOutput="true" />
    </contentFiles>
  </metadata>
</package>
```

Unfortunately this doesn't work for me :( It does not include anything. How can include my files?
I also don't get what even is this "contentFiles" directory structure for...

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe):

Product version: 5.6.9

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.org temporarily down due to Azure services outage" (#57) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet.org is being affected by an outage due to issues affecting the Azure Portal and Azure services, but the team is on it. We appreciate your patience and we will keep you updated as soon as we get more information.

In the meantime, check https://status2.azure.com/ for Azure updates and find work-arounds in this thread https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8480.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Notice: NuGet Restore Failures on Linux distributions using NSS or Mozilla root CA list" (#56) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## Context

Users of .NET 5.0+ will receive error messages when running `dotnet restore` on Linux distros that use [nss](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Projects/NSS/) or `ca-certificates` packages maintained by Mozilla's root CA list. The root cause is due to the certificate used for signed NuGet packages recently expiring and as a result the validation for packages uses a timestamp provider chain that has a root certificate that has been [removed by Network Security Services (NSS)](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1686854) which is a popular alternative to [OpenSSL](https://github.com/openssl/openssl).

- [NuGet Microsoft Author Signing Certificate Update](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/microsoft-author-signing-certificate-update/) - Expires January 27th, 2021
- [NuGet.org Repository Signing Certificate Update](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/) - Expires April 14th, 2021

For more information, please read the [Distrust of Symantec TLS Certificates](https://blog.mozilla.org/security/2018/03/12/distrust-symantec-tls-certificates/) on the Mozilla Security Blog, [Mozilla Root Store Policy](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/about/governance/policies/security-group/certs/policy/) on Mozilla.org, and [Symantec Issues](https://wiki.mozilla.org/CA:Symantec_Issues) on the Mozilla Wiki Page.

## Affected Environments

.NET 5.0+ SDK on Linux distros that use [nss 3.63+](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Projects/NSS/NSS_3.63_release_notes). 

At this time, we are not sure of every distro that may be affected. If you're aware of an affected distro, please let us know!

Below is a table that includes .NET support for Linux distros:

### Linux

OS                                    | Version               | Affected          |
--------------------------------------|-----------------------|-------------------|
[Alpine Linux][Alpine]                | N/A                 | ‚ùì |
[CentOS][CentOS]                      | N/A                    | ‚ùì |
[Debian][Debian]                      | N/A                    | ‚ùì |
[Fedora][Fedora]                      | N/A                   | ‚ùì |
[Linux Mint][Linux-Mint]              | N/A                   | ‚ùì |
[openSUSE][OpenSUSE]                  | N/A                   | ‚ùì |
[Red Hat Enterprise Linux][RHEL]      | N/A                    | ‚ùì |
[SUSE Enterprise Linux (SLES)][SLES]  | N/A               | ‚ùì |
[Ubuntu][Ubuntu]                      | N/A   | ‚ùì |

[Alpine]: https://alpinelinux.org/
[CentOS]: https://www.centos.org/
[Debian]: https://www.debian.org/
[Fedora]: https://getfedora.org/
[Linux-Mint]: https://linuxmint.com/
[OpenSUSE]: https://opensuse.org/
[RHEL]: https://www.redhat.com/en/technologies/linux-platforms/enterprise-linux
[SLES]: https://www.suse.com/products/server/
[Ubuntu]: https://ubuntu.com/

Additionally, here is a table of other Linux variants that may be affected but are not officially supported by .NET.

OS                                    | Version               | Affected       |
--------------------------------------|-----------------------|-------------------|
[Arch Linux](https://archlinux.org/)                          | 20210328+                 | ‚úÖ[Issue](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10695)             |
[Artix Linux](https://artixlinux.org/)                         | 20201128+                    | ‚úÖ[Issue](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10684)             |

### Other Linux distros

- At the time of writing, we believe other distributions will not be affected until a distribution is updated to include [nss 3.63+](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Projects/NSS/NSS_3.63_release_notes).

## Mitigation

### .NET Core 3.1

.NET 5 introduces a signing verification mechanism that promotes warnings to throw an error at `dotnet restore` time. To work around this, you can temporarily target against .NET Core 3.1.

### Modify CA Certificate Store

Depending on your Linux distro, you can modify your CA certificate store by taking on an earlier version of your `ca-certificates` package.

For reference, the affected version is [nss 3.63+](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Projects/NSS/NSS_3.63_release_notes). `nss` includes a hard-coded list of trusted CA certificates and therefore can be modified to include and trust the `Verisign Universal Root Certificate Authority` again.

Many Linux distros can leverage `dpkg-reconfigure` to check for the entry and enable trust for it. As a manual workaround, you may need to remove a `leading !` from the certificate line & update your CA certificates package.

**Note:** Doing this is considered a bad security practice & should only be done if you understand the security implications of doing so.

## Solution

Due to existing issues with the .NET 5 signing verification feature & fallback of timestamp verification, we have decided to revoke this feature for Unix-based systems within .NET 5 SDK. Therefore your experience of using `dotnet restore` will remain largely the same as it was in .NET Core 3.1. Stay tuned for an updated .NET SDK version that will include this change.

### Stay updated

- We are continuing to investigate this issue and will let you know more as we find out.
- We will also continue posting updates on [NuGet Status](https://status.nuget.org/) and [@NuGet on Twitter](https://twitter.com/nuget).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Package Namespaces Proposal" (#55) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Introduction of a feature concept called Package Namespaces which allows a developer to include or exclude package IDs by specifying package namespaces on their package source(s).

üéâüì¶Please provide your comments, concerns, and feedback within this PR. üì¶üéâ

https://github.com/NuGet/Home/pull/10660

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Custom V2 OData queries will be deprecated March 9th, 2021 " (#54) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (#37) last year and conducted a dry run of the deprecation to ensure that there are no surprises for users (#40). 

We will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in March 9, 2021, as detailed in [the blogpost here](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/custom-v2-odata-queries-will-be-deprecated-march-9-2021/).

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post.](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021" (#53) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by March 15th, 2021 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/

Events.RelatedBody:

```
  Determining projects to restore...
/builds/company/modules/myproject/myproject.Tests/myproject.Tests.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging 5.6.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
/builds/company/modules/myproject/myproject/myproject.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'System.Security.Principal.Windows 4.5.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain 
.......
```
